titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 13, 2019 at 07:11

did.unittitle: Diaries (Miscellaneous) collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: An artificial collection of diaries relating to Connecticut and other states and regions in the United States. Topics including farming, religion, military life, student life, travel, and the weather are documented.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Diaries (Miscellaneous) Collection (MS 181). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: The Michael F. Campbell diary is also available on microfilm (290 frames on 1 reel, 35 mm.) from Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library, at cost. Order no. HM212.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The diaries are arranged alphabetically by diarist name, beginning with anonymous entries, and assigned sequential numbers which appear in the folder column for boxes 1-18. The remainder of the diaries are also assigned sequential numbers, however, there is no alphabetical order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of miscellaneous diaries which are not part of any other collection.
All diaries, except those by anonymous writers, are catalogued. Cards are filed in the catalogue under author, subject, and geographical location.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

Copied by Theodore Salisbury Woolsey from the original in the library at Cornwall, Connecticut. Published in Papers and Addresses of the Society of Colonial Wars in the State of Connecticut , vol., pp. 311-329.

Time book for music lessons, New Haven

Diaries of personal entries kept by a rubber overseer of New Haven

Diary of personal entries, Hamden, Connecticut. Diary contains accounts by Mrs. Fowler's husband, George H. Fowler

Holman, Lucia (Ruggles) (1793-1886), Journal of a voyage to the Sandwich Islands and residence there. This journal is in the form of letters from Mrs. Holman to her family. It is published in Bishop Museum, Special Publication, No. 17.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: The original diary is owned by the Yale University Art Gallery and was returned to their Department of Indo-Pacific Art in 2018.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: The diary is available in digital form from Manuscripts and Archives.

King, Alexander (1749-1831), Diary and account book, various places, . Included is an account of naval action at Fort Ticonderoga in 1776 . Added are the births of King's children, orders as selectman New Windsor, Connecticut, and payments to the First Society of East Windsor
Knous, Samuel, Business memorandum books kept by an armorer and munitions inspector, Springfield, Massachusetts
Lake, James K., Diary kept by a resident of Albion, New York, while visiting his grandparents in Sharon, Connecticut, . Laid in are four bills of sale for tobacco and livestock
[Lanman, John Trumbull (1820-18520], Journal of a voyage onboard the barque Condor from New York to Valparaiso, Chile
[Little, Mr.], Journal of a trip from Colombia, Connecticut, to Avon, New York
Lott, Abraham, Diary (copy) of a trip from Kinderhook, New York, to Albany. Original diary is in the Columbia County Historical Society, Kinderhook, New York.
Loveland, George Henry, a resident of Middletown, Connecticut

Journal kept on board the ship Bald Eagle on a voyage from New York to San Francisco. Added are the journals of the author kept on board the ship Tuskina on three voyages from San Francisco to Puget Sound.

Journal (copy) kept on board the ship Wild Pigeon on a voyage from New York around the world, . Added is the journal (copy) of the author kept on board the ship Bald Eagle on a voyage from New York to San Francisco . Copied from the original by the author and completed 1890

Journal (copy) kept on board the ship Tuskina on three voyages from San Francisco to Puget Sound and return. Added is the journal (copy) the author kept on board the ship Bald Eagle . Copied from the original by the author and completed.

Washburne, Elihu Benjamin (1816-1887), four diaries of personal entries and observations of events from various places during the Civil War and one pocket ledger, various places. Vols. 303 and 304 give eyewitness accounts of the Battle of the Wilderness and General Lee's surrender at Appomattox Court House.

Steward, Ira R. (1795-), Autobiography of a New London minister
Clark, Kate (Upson) (1851-1935), Diaries, Diary of 1869 includes pamphlet, lectures, and informal talks by Mrs. Kate Upson Clark

Wickes, Simon Alexander (1806/7-1834), Diary (typed copy) kept by a Yale student, various places. Majority of entries describe a summer of study with Henry Dutton in Newton, Connecticut. Original in the possession of the Maryland Historical Society.

odd.head: General note
